            PROJECT (BANK EXE.)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the North West Frontier
            Province (NWFP) On-Farm Water Management Project for
            Pakistan were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: For projects of
            this level of complexity, a full time project director and
            more structured project management unit with adequate
            staffing will be essential. Projects, which envisage a major
            institutional development component entailing beneficiary
            participation, will require a sufficient lead time before
            the physical investment activities start to allow adequate
            social mobilization process. At design stage, the project
            risks should be properly assessed, especially in terms of
            its broader policy environment and political commitments of
            the Government. For effective implementation of financial
            management system, the donor agencies reporting requirements
            need be harmonized and aligned to the borrower's
            accounting system and the counterpart accounting staff and
            independent auditors should be given adequate training.
